comments.raw_text:
At the moment we're failing WebGL tests possibly due to driver/software issues (at least on the virtual boxes).

Slightly different errors for each platform.

Linux comm-central-trunk debug test mochitests-1/5:
[GLX] your GL driver is currently blocked. If you would like to bypass this, define the MOZ_GLX_IGNORE_BLACKLIST environment variable.
JavaScript warning: http://mochi.test:8888/tests/content/canvas/test/webgl/test_webgl_conformance_test_suite.html, line 267: WebGL: Can't get a usable WebGL context
35330 ERROR TEST-UNEXPECTED-FAIL | /tests/content/canvas/test/webgl/test_webgl_conformance_test_suite.html | Can't create a WebGL context

For example see http://tinderbox.mozilla.org/showlog.cgi?log=SeaMonkey/1301401213.1301404592.14947.gz#err0

WINNT 5.2 comm-central-trunk debug test mochitests-1/5:
JavaScript warning: http://mochi.test:8888/tests/content/canvas/test/webgl/test_webgl_conformance_test_suite.html, line 267: WebGL: Can't get a usable WebGL context
35353 ERROR TEST-UNEXPECTED-FAIL | /tests/content/canvas/test/webgl/test_webgl_conformance_test_suite.html | Can't create a WebGL context

An example - http://tinderbox.mozilla.org/showlog.cgi?log=SeaMonkey/1301416591.1301419406.16237.gz#err0

OS X 10.6 comm-central-trunk debug test mochitests-1/5:
WARNING: Couldn't init gGlobalContext.: file /builds/slave/comm-cen-trunk-osx64-dbg/build/mozilla/gfx/thebes/GLContextProviderCGL.mm, line 604
JavaScript warning: http://mochi.test:8888/tests/content/canvas/test/webgl/test_webgl_conformance_test_suite.html, line 267: WebGL: Can't get a usable WebGL context
39433 ERROR TEST-UNEXPECTED-FAIL | /tests/content/canvas/test/webgl/test_webgl_conformance_test_suite.html | Can't create a WebGL context

An example - http://tinderbox.mozilla.org/showlog.cgi?log=SeaMonkey/1301422432.1301424480.7063.gz#err0
comments.creator: iannbugzilla@gmail.com

comments.raw_text: I think this is not fixable.
comments.text: I think this is not fixable.
comments.author: kairo@kairo.at
comments.creator: kairo@kairo.at

comments.author: bugzillamozillaorg_serge_20140323@gautherie.fr
comments.creator: bugzillamozillaorg_serge_20140323@gautherie.fr
comments.text:
(In reply to comment #1)
> I think this is not fixable.

Ftr, your bug 629595 comment 3:
{
Robert Kaiser      2011-01-28 05:27:36 PST

(In reply to comment #1)
> 2) SeaMonkey boxes could be "updated".

They can't, we are running tests on the build boxes and so this is nailed down.
We need to care that nothing requiring GL (or something not present on a
CentOS5 VM) runs on those machines.
}
comments.raw_text:
(In reply to comment #1)
> I think this is not fixable.

Ftr, your bug 629595 comment 3:
{
Robert Kaiser      2011-01-28 05:27:36 PST

(In reply to comment #1)
> 2) SeaMonkey boxes could be "updated".

They can't, we are running tests on the build boxes and so this is nailed down.
We need to care that nothing requiring GL (or something not present on a
CentOS5 VM) runs on those machines.
}

(In reply to Serge Gautherie (:sgautherie) from comment #2)
> We need to care that nothing requiring GL (or something not present on a
> CentOS5 VM) runs on those machines.

I guess CentOS5 VM are our "Linux" boxes.
Not sure whether our MacOSX 10.5/10.6 and/or Windows 2003 boxes could be fixed.
